  |doublesrecord = 264-218 |doublestitles = 13 |highestdoublesranking = No. 23
  (24 March 1980) |AustralianOpenDoublesresult = |FrenchOpenDoublesresult =
  |WimbledonDoublesresult = SF (1976) |USOpenDoublesresult = |updated = 13 June
  2012 }} 'Vijay Amritraj' (, born 14 December 1953) is a former Indian tennis
  player, sports commentator and actor. [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0025398/
  Vijay Amritraj] at the Internet Movie Database

Vijay was born in Chennai, India to Maggie Dhairyam and Robert Amritraj. [http://www.hindu.com/mp/2004/07/29/stories/2004072900950400.htm
The Hindu : At home on every turf ] He and his
brothers, Anand Amritraj and Ashok Amritraj, were among the first Indians to
play in top-flight international tour tennis. They did their schooling in Don
Bosco Egmore, Chennai, and later graduated from Loyola College, Chennai. In
1976, the brothers (Vijay and Anand) were semifinalists in the Wimbledon men's
doubles. He was awarded the Padma Shri in 1983.
categories: Indian emigrants to the United States
